column4: Hi, I'm trying to install Ubuntu onto a system with Windows and make it dual-boot but I am having problems. I installed Ubuntu to a seperate HD and installed grub to a boot partition I created (/dev/sda3). I then used dd to copy the first 512 bytes of sda3's bootsector (I think?) to a bin file, and used that bin file to create a boot option in Window's boot loader. It worked, however after I selected 'linux' to boot, the screen showed
no, grub is installed fine thats not the problem
